page.title: 02TYPICAL HOUSING IN COWPLAIN
page.content: In the main part of the built-up area there are detached,semi-detached and terraced houses.They are of brick construction with tile roofs.There are also bungalows,both detached and semi-detached.These are built of the same materials.Most new houses have either garage space or a garage but many of those built before the 1950's have neither. On the edge of the built-up area there are a few houses of stone and stone with wood construction.There are also some shops and schools. Further out buildings are sparse, it is a country area.There are some conventional buildings but also some frame cottages with what we believe are wattle and daub walls and flint walls.Some have thatched roofs. One of them was being rethatched.There are a number of pubs,a village hall,a stone manor house and a mission hall.
